remarks: The predicate "is a regular space."  In a regular space, any open neighborhood has a closed subneighborhood.  Note that some authors require the space to be Hausdorff (which would make it the same as T_3), but we reserve the phrase "regular Hausdorff" for that as many topologists do.  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 1-Feb-2010.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
